Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 15th overall pick, by Halifax in 1977...
Had first career hit on 5/20/1980, off Jack Langford (TRO)...
Hit first career homerun on 5/26/1980, off Carmine Rosa (PEN)...
Drove in 6 runs against Penn on 5/19/1983...
Had 25-game hitting streak snapped on 7/13/1985...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Second Base in 1985...
Signed as a free agent by Halifax on 2/6/1986 to a 3-year deal worth $3,405,500 per year...
Drove in 6 runs against Pontiac on 6/10/1987...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Second Base in 1987...
Traded from Halifax to Gashouse on 4/19/1988 (Going to GHG: 2B P. Ibañez. Going to HAL: P T. Prahl, P K. Sims, C W. Prindle)...
Won Player of the Week award on 7/14/1988, hitting .423 with 1 HR, 5 RBI...
